sentences.en: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.cn: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

sentences.en: Between 1965 and 1969 Germany had a similar coalition cabinet.
sentences.cn: 1965年至1969年,类似的联合大内阁就曾经哉西德产生过.

sentences.en: By mid-1988 there were clear indications of the extreme fragility of the Right-wing coalition.
sentences.cn: 到1988年年中，有明显迹象表明右翼联盟极度脆弱。

sentences.en: Coalition forces take great care to avoid civilian casualties.
sentences.cn: 联盟军队竭尽全力避免造成平民伤亡.

sentences.en: He had been opposed by a coalition of about 50 civil rights, women's and Latino organizations.
sentences.cn: 大约有50个民权组织、女性社团和拉丁裔社团联合起来反对他。

sentences.en: His coalition may hold a clear majority but this could quickly fall away.
sentences.cn: 他的联盟也许会占绝对多数，但这种优势可能会很快丧失。

sentences.en: In 1805, Austria, Russia, and Sweden joined Britain in a new coalition against France and Spain.
sentences.cn: 1805年, 奥地利, 俄国和瑞典同英国组成了反对法国和西班牙的新联盟.

sentences.en: In the history of coalition warfare such impasses have been common, and sometimes disastrous.
sentences.cn: 在联合作战的历史中,这种相持不下的局面是很普通的, 往往也是灾难性的.

sentences.en: It's the coalition forces who are to blame for the continuation of the war.
sentences.cn: 联合部队应当对战争的延续负责。

sentences.en: Many of the coalition members could have their own political agendas.
sentences.cn: 许多联盟成员可能会有他们自己的政治议题。

sentences.en: Our domestic enterprises to jointly create a coalition agreement!
sentences.cn: 我们与国内多家企业创建了共同联盟协议!
政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.en: The coalition could break down before the five years expire .
sentences.cn: 此次联合可能在五年期限结束之前就破裂。

sentences.en: The coalition, however, lacks three essential components of a successful strategy.
sentences.cn: 然而联军的成功策略缺乏三个重要组成部分.

sentences.en: The enemy coalition was unstable enough.
sentences.cn: 敌人的联盟是很不稳固的.

sentences.en: There is no coalition of members of the economy.
sentences.cn: 这种经济的各部门之间不存在联合.

sentences.en: This can only be achieved by a coalition of the different groups.
sentences.cn: 这只能通过不同团体相联合来实现.

trans.tran_en: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together
